vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἀξί-ωμα, ατος, τό,
that of which one is thought worthy, an honour, γάμων.. ἀξίωμ᾽ ἐδέξατο[Refs 5th c.BC+]; οἳ τὰς πόλεις ἔχουσι κἀξιώματα[Refs]; τὸ τῆς πόλεως ἀ. the dignity of the city's representative, [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__2 honour, reputation, [Refs 5th c.BC+] claim on ground of merit, [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__3 rank, position, ἀξιώματος ἀφάνεια[Refs 5th c.BC+]
__4 of things, worth, quality, οὐ τῷ πλήθει ἀλλὰ τῷ ἀ.[Refs 5th c.BC+]
__5 concrete, things of dignity, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__II that which is thought fit, decision, decree, δαιμόνων[Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II.2 in Science, that which is assumed as the basis of demonstration, selfevident principle, [Refs 4th c.BC+] W.:—in Mathematics texts, axiom, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; philosophical doctrine, τὸ Ζήνωνος ἀ.[Refs]; logical proposition, [Refs 3rd c.BC+]
__II.3 request, petition, ἱκετικὸν ἀ.[Refs 1st c.BC+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: a petition; that which is fit; worth
vocabInfos.mediumDef: a petition; that which is fit; worth
